thread.title: Sergio Aguero reveals Man City future is out of his hands
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero reveals Man City future is out of his hands

author: Stuart Brennan
title: Sergio Aguero reveals Man City future is out of his hands
text:
Sport Sergio Aguero reveals Man City future is out of his hands Mancheter City striker is again on the bench as Gabriel Jesus continues with his flying start to life with the Blues     
Sergio Aguero is unsure about his Manchester City future … even though he wants to stay. 
The Argentina striker was on the subs' bench for the second match running as the Blues beat Swansea 2-1 – with his replacement Gabriel Jesus grabbing both goals. 
And after Aguero was spotted in a meeting with his agent and manager Pep Guardiola in a Manchester restaurant recently, speculation grew that City might be prepared to let their legendary goalscorer go. 
Aguero has no intention of leaving, but it could be out of his hands. 
And he seemed relaxed about his sudden demotion, with Jesus grabbing his opportunity with both hands. 
“Sometimes this happens,” said Aguero. “When you’re on the bench you have to wait for your opportunity. 
“I have to help the team as much as I can in these three months, afterwards we’ll see what the club wants to do with me. I want to stay, of course.” Read More Man City player ratings: Gabriel Jesus the saviour but Yaya Toure shines again 
Asked about the meeting with Guardiola, Aguero said there was nothing suspicious: “Things to do with the club, nothing strange. Private things that have to stay inside those walls,” he said. 
Aguero only signed a contract extension earlier this year, although the club stayed quiet on the matter, and he has repeatedly expressed his happiness at City. 
He did it again, saying: “In three years my contract is up, that’s why I say I’m happy at the club. 
“In these last three months that are left I have to help the club and as I say the club will decide if I have a place here or not.” Read More
